column2: The eruption of the second Russian Civil War in Russia made part of our Syndicalist population organize themselves and leave the country to join the Soviet struggle. Shall we allow them to leave our country to join the civil war ?
This might be playing with fire
Our fight for socialism has attracted the attention of fellow socialists in Belarus. Together they organized themself and many have decided to leave their homes to join our fight for socialism!
We need all the help we can get!

Russia should start being more active on the world stage but we are too weak to interfere in the German or Japanese spheres of influence. The Caucasus, bordering the dying Ottoman Empire, is an easy region to subjugate and has large oil deposits for us to exploit. Central Asia, with its unstable situation between Alash Orda and Turkestan, is an even more easier region to subjugate. We should choose between these areas as we don't have the resources for simultanious actions in both regions.
The Central Asian tribes must be brought into the fold!

We have chosen to expand in the Caucasus. We must decide whether we want to conquer the entire Caucasus or limit our operations to Georgia, Azerbaijan or Don-Kuban. If we bite off more than we can chew we can have problems, both internal and international.
We will only secure the Don-Kuban steppes!
We must bring Georgia and Azerbaijan into the fold as well!
We must secure the entire Caucasus!

Our secret service reports that Russia plans to once again secure the Caucasus region. Such a drastic step means a direct threat to the stability of Eastern Europe which was set by the Treaty of Brestl-Litovsk. What shall we do?
Demand that Russia respects the Brest-Litovsk treaty!
Threaten Russia and invite the endangered nations into Mitteleuropa!
We don't care about the Caucasus.

Russian attempts to reassert its sphere of influence on the Caucasus has not gone unnoticed by the German Empire. Diplomatic representatives of German Empire have approached us, seeking to include us into Mitteleuropa as a means of protection from Russia. How should we react?
The Don-Kuban Union has accepted our offer. Now they are a part of Mitteleuropa.

Russian attempts to reaasert its sphere of influence on the Caucasus has not gone unnoticed by the German Empire. Diplomatic representatives of German Empire have approached us, seeking to include us into Mitteleuropa as a means of protection from Russia. How should we react?
Azerbaijan has accepted our offer. Now they are a part of Mitteleuropa.

Russian attempts to reaasert its sphere of influence on the Caucasus has not gone unnoticed by the German Empire. Diplomatic representatives of German Empire have approached us, seeking to include us into Mitteleuropa as a means of protection from Russia. How should we react?
Mountain Republic has accepted our offer. Now they are a part of Mitteleuropa.

The German Kaiser has made it clear that his Empire would fully support the independence of the Caucasian nations if any other nation tries to interfere. It would be most unwise to underestimate them despite the troubles they are facing on the homefront. How shall we react to this statement?
Let us focus on Central Asia!
Give up our plans of expansion.
The Russian state, in its foolish pride, has refused our reasonable demands regarding the territorial integrity and independence of the Caucasian states. How shall we react to this insolence?
column13: Из-за дурацкой гордости Россия отвергла наши законные требования об уважении территориальной целостности и независимости государств Кавказа. Как мы отреагируем?

column2: Cease all contacts between Mitteleuropa and Russia!
Insolent brats, we will show you German might!
column13: Наглые выскочки! Вы познаете мощь Германии!

column2: Back down, we can not afford a conflict with Russia.
column13: Отступиться. Мы не можем допустить войны с Россией.

column2: Mitteleuropa ceases all contacts with us
column13: Срединная Европа разорвала все контакты с нами

column2: In reaction to our refusal to alter the planned ґstabilizationґ of the Caucasian region the German Empire has ordered the cessation of all trade and diplomatic contacts between our state and Mitteleuropa. Our industrial sector is already feeling the consequences of such drastic actions.
We have successfully subjugated the Caucasian nations. We can now expand in Central Asia and bring order to these troubled lands.
column13: Мы успешно разобрались с кавказскими странами. Теперь мы можем принести порядок в Среднюю Азию.

column2: We have chosen to expand in Central Asia. We must decide whetever we want to conquer Central Asia as a whole or limit our plans to Alash-Orda. This region is forgotten and we don't expect international problems, although the Central Asian tribes might prove to be a nuisance.
We have successfully achieved all of our goals in Central Asia. Now we can expand our borders into the Caucasian region and bring order to these troubled lands.
column13: Мы полностью достигли наших целей в Средней Азии. Теперь мы можем заняться Кавказом и принести порядок в эти земли.

column2: We have successfully achieved all our goals in Central Asia. Unfortunately, expansion into the Caucasus is impossible thanks to German protection over the Don-Kuban union and Azerbaijan. We can either wait for a better opportunity to expand into the Caucasus, risk expansion into the Far East or give up expansionism altogether. What shall we do?
We will focus on the Far East!
We will wait for a better opportunity to strike at the Caucasus!

We have successfully achieved all our goals in Central Asia and in the Far East. We are finally strong enough to directly interfere in the German sphere of influence in the Caucasus. Shall we focus our power there ?
We shall finally seize control of the Caucasus!

With a war raging in the west the German Empire is unable to fully protect its sphere of influence in the Caucasus. This presents us with the unique opportunity to expand Russian influence to the Caucasus. The only question is how Russia will achieve its goals in the Caucasus.
Offer the German Empire an alliance, for a price...
Russia demands concessions in the Caucasus

The government of the Russian state has announced recently that they want to reorganize the existing sphere of influence in Caucasus in their favour. They demand the cessation of all guarantees towards the Caucasian states as well as accepting these states as part of the Russian sphere of influence. In return they promise to respect the existing order in Europe and support German Empire economically in the ongoing war. How shall we respond ?
The foolish leadership of the German Empire refused our reasonable demands regarding the Caucasus, peace between Russia and Germany seems impossible! What shall we do now?
The German Empire has betrayed us by accepting all Russian demands regarding the Caucasus, leaving us alone to face the might of the Russian state.
There is nothing we can do...
The German Empire has betrayed us by accepting all Russian demands regarding the Caucasus, leaving us alone to face the might of the Russian state.
There is nothing we can do...
The German Empire has betrayed us by accepting all Russian demands regarding the Caucasus, leaving us alone to face the might of the Russian state.
There is nothing we can do...
Russia wants to join Mitteleuropa at a cost.

The government of the Russian state recently announced that they want to join Mitteleuropa in order to save Europe from syndicalism. They demand the cessation of all guarantees towards the Caucasian states as well as accepting these states as part of the Russian sphere of influence. How shall we respond?

The government of the German Empire has accepted our reasonable demands regarding spheres of influence in the Caucasus. The Don-Kuban Union, formerly under the protection of the German Empire, is now at our mercy. What shall we do with this rebellious state?
Demand the full integration of the Don-Kuban Union!

The government of the German Empire has accepted our reasonable demands regarding spheres of influence in the Caucasus. Azerbaijan, formerly under the protection of the German Empire, is now at our mercy. What shall we do with this rebellious state?
Demand the full integration of Azerbaijan!

The government of the German Empire has accepted our reasonable demands regarding spheres of influence in the Caucasus. Mountain Republic, formerly under the protection of the German Empire, is now at our mercy. What shall we do with this rebellious state?
Demand the full integration of Mountain Republic!

With the eruption of the Second Weltkrieg the attention of the German Empire turned westwards. In effort to gain the support of the Russian state in their ongoing struggle the German Empire has accepted Russian demands regarding spheres of influence in the Caucasus, handing the fate of the Caucasian states to them. Russia has issued series of demands towards our state which, if accepted, will mean the end of our state as independent unit. What shall we do?
Russia demands reformation of our government

With the eruption of the Second Weltkrieg the attention of the German Empire turned westwards. In effort to gain the support of the Russian state in their ongoing struggle the German Empire has accepted Russian demands regarding spheres of influence in the Caucasus, handing the fate of the Caucasian states to them. Russia has issued series of demands towards our state which, if accepted, will mean the end of our state as independent unit. What shall we do?

With the eruption of the Second Weltkrieg the attention of the German Empire turned westwards. In effort to gain the support of the Russian state in their ongoing struggle the German Empire has accepted Russian demands regarding spheres of influence in the Caucasus, handing the fate of the Caucasian states to them. Russia has issued series of demands towards our state which, if accepted, will mean the end of our state as independent unit. What shall we do?
Russia demands reformation of our government

With the eruption of the Second Weltkrieg the attention of the German Empire turned westwards. In effort to gain the support of the Russian state in their ongoing struggle the German Empire has accepted Russian demands regarding spheres of influence in the Caucasus, handing the fate of the Caucasian states to them. Russia has issued series of demands towards our state which, if accepted, will mean the end of our state as independent unit. What shall we do?
The demise of the Don-Kuban Union
Seeing no other realistic option the government of the Don-Kuban Union was forced to accept our demands.
The Don-Kuban Union resist our demands
The foolish government of the Don-Kuban Union refused our reasonable demands regarding their rogue state. How shall we react to this insolence?
We shall deal with them later.
The submission of the Don-Kuban Union
Seeing no other realistic option the government of the Don-Kuban Union was forced to accept our demands.
Seeing no other realistic option the government of Azerbaijan was forced to accept our demands.
The foolish government of Azerbaijan has refused our reasonable demands regarding their rogue state. How shall we react to this insolence?
We shall deal with them later.
Seeing no other realistic option the government of Azerbaijan was forced to accept our demands.

With the eruption of the Second Weltkrieg the attention of the German Empire turned westwards. In effort to gain the support of the Russian state in their ongoing struggle the German Empire has accepted Russian demands regarding spheres of influence in the Caucasus, handing the fate of the Caucasian states to them. Russia has issued series of demands towards our state which, if accepted, will mean the end of our state as independent unit. What shall we do?
Russia demands reformation of our government

With the eruption of the Second Weltkrieg the attention of the German Empire turned westwards. In effort to gain the support of the Russian state in their ongoing struggle the German Empire has accepted Russian demands regarding spheres of influence in the Caucasus, handing the fate of the Caucasian states to them. Russia has issued series of demands towards our state which, if accepted, will mean the end of our state as independent unit. What shall we do?
The demise of the Mountain Republic
Seeing no other realistic option the government of the Mountain Republic was forced to accept our demands.
The Mountain Republic resist our demands
The foolish government of the Mountain Republic refused our reasonable demands regarding their rogue state. How shall we react to this insolence?
We shall deal with them later.
The submission of the Mountain Republic
Seeing no other realistic option the government of the Mountain Republic was forced to accept our demands.

Russia is now stronger than before after conquering both the Caucasus and Central Asia. Now we can start actions in the Far East, in Eastern Europe or in the Middle East. We can't engage in more than one area as we are still not powerful enough to fight the Germans and the Japanese simultaneously. We must choose our directions carefully as the international situation is becoming more and more unstable.
We will focus on the Far East!
We will focus on Eastern Europe!
We will focus on the Middle East!

Russia is now stronger than before after conquering both the Caucasus and Central Asia. Now we can start actions in the Far East, in Eastern Europe or in the Middle East. We can't engage in more than one area as we are still not powerful enough to fight the Germans and the Japanese simultaneously. We must choose our directions carefully as the international situation is becoming more and more unstable.
We will focus on the Far East!
We will focus on Eastern Europe!
We will focus on the Middle East!

We have decided to start actions in the Far East. We will probably meet Japanese resistance by interfering in their sphere of influence. This may give us the chance to avenge the deaths of our fathers and grandfathers who died for Russian Manchuria!
We will take back the Trans-Siberian railway!
We must secure Mongolia and Sinkiang as well!
We must restore our place in the Far East!

We have decided to start actions in Eastern Europe. The stakes are high and we must be extremely careful as we don't want to start the a war with Germany over our former lands. We must decide what our goals will be. One mistake and Europe will be plunged into chaos.
We must restore our dominance over the Ukraine and Belarus!
We must secure the Baltic governates as well!
We will restore our borders in full!

Recent reassurgence of the Russian state in the east together with recent russian diplomatic activity through the eastern Europe proves, that in order to keep our state and its borders intact, we need to gain protection of German Empire and Mitteleuropa alliance. Hovewer doing will mean definite military involvement of our state in any potential conflict in the western europe and may further worsen our relations with Russia. What shall we do ?

Government of Finland, afraid of recent agressive russian foreign policy has annouced recently that they want to join Mitteleuropa alliance. It's not a sudden move because pro-German policy is popular in many circles including the ruling cabinet and army. Do we want to allow Finland to join our alliance and protect them from potential Russian diplomatic and economical offensive ?
Stable relationship with Russia is more important.
column13: Хорошие отношения с Россией более важны

column2: Germans accepted our offer and invited us into Mitteleuropa alliance. Now our independence and territorial integrity are protected by powerfull German armed forces.

Recent reassurgence of the Russian state in the east together with recent russian diplomatic activity through the eastern Europe proves, that in order to keep our state, its independence and its borders intact, we need to gain protection of German Empire and Mitteleuropa alliance. Hovewer doing will mean definite military involvement of our state in any potential conflict in the western europe and may further worsen our relations with Russia. What shall we do ?

It's not a sudden move because pro-German policy is popular in many circles including the ruling cabinet and army. Do we want to allow Poland to join our alliance and protect them from potential Russian diplomatic and economical offensive ?
Stable relationship with Russia is more important.

We have decided to take care of the Middle Eastern nations. Turkey is weak so we don't need to fear them. However, we must assign priorities in our Middle Eastern policy, do we want to take over Turkey or maybe even Persia?
We we must liberate Greater Armenia!
We shall finally liberate Constantinople and the Bosporus!
All of the Middle East must bow under our influence!

The vast territories of the Far East, the snowy mountains of the Caucasus and the sandy steppes of Central Asia are now under the control of Russia, our former lands returned to us. Our justice is nearly finished but we still have some unresolved issues in Eastern Europe and the Middle East. Russia has to choose where to concentrate their attention next, maybe it's time to stop expanding?
We will focus on Eastern Europe!
We will focus on the Middle East!
We will focus on the Middle East!
Russia must remain vigillant if it is to keep all of its territories!
We have achieved all our goals!
Russia must remain vigillant if it is to keep all of its territories!
We have achieved all our goals!
Russia must remain vigillant if it is to keep all of its territories!
We have achieved all our goals!

The vast deserts of the Middle East, the snowy mountains of the Caucasus and the sandy steppes of Central Asia are now under the control of Russia, our former lands returned to us. Our justice is nearly finished but we still have unresolved issues in Eastern Europe and the Far East. The Russian government has to choose where to concentrate their attention next, maybe it's time to stop expanding?
We will focus on Eastern Europe!
We will focus on the Far East!

The vast territories of Eastern Europe, the snowy mountains of the Caucasus and the sandy steppes of Central Asia are now under the control of Russia, our former lands returned to us. Our justice is nearly finished but we still have unresolved issues in the Middle East and the Far East. The Russian government has to choose where to concentrate their attention next, maybe it's time to stop expanding?
We will focus on the Middle East!
We will focus on the Far East!
We will focus on the Middle East!
We will focus on Eastern Europe!

We can't engage in more than one area as we are not powerful enough to fight the Germans and the Japanese simultaneously. We must choose our directions carefully as the international situation is becoming more and more unstable.

Signed in 1918, roughly a year after the fall of Nikolai II, the Russian constitution defines the country's political institutions. The legislative branch consists of the State Duma, elected every five years, and the Senate, consisting of senior nobles, statemen, scholars, etc. The executive branch is divided into the office of President, elected every six years by the Senate, and the Council of Ministers.
The constitution guarantees freedom and stability!

Yesterday a new monument, built to commemorate one the Russia's greatest poets, has been uncovered in our capital. The 100th anniversary of Pushkin's death is a chance to recall the great days of Russian history and culture, an act of paramount importance during these dark times of crisis and instability.
With the Bolsheviks in power only one single step remains between transforming the rotten Russia into a new, Communist state.
We are not ready for this.
With Wrangel being in power for such a long time many people are suggesting that a formal coronation should take place, thereby legitimising the Vozhd's authority over Russia.
The Tsar is unhappy about food prices
The Tsar recently visited one of the local stores in our capital and he is outraged by the high prices of meat and other necessary products.
Three hoorays for our caring Tsar!

'Princypiya geopolitiki', published in the late 30's by Nikolai Trubetskoy, is now considered a cornerstone of modern geopolitics. In his book the Russian conservative philosopher and politician envisioned a new Russian Empire. Defined not by the Tsardom or religion but rather by pragmatic control over the Eurasian continent. His ideas were further developed by Lev Gumilov thus creating the so-called Eurasian Doctrine.

With the Russian situation slowly stabilising some politicians, philosophers and scholars are attempting to revive the 19th century concept of Pan-Slavism, a vision of a united Slavic federation, centered around Russia. These ideas are gaining quick support amongst the conservative military officers, including Anton Denikin and Petr Wrangel.
The Anarchists, Socialists, Syndicalists and Bolsheviks are weakening the stability of our Motherland. Recently one of them assassinated a famous general. God only knows who they will kill next time!
I want the head of the bomber on my desk!
The Anarchists, Socialists, Syndicalists and Bolsheviks are weakening the stability of our Motherland. Recently one of them assassinated a gubernator. God only knows who they will kill next time!
I want the head of the murderer on my desk!

The Anarchists, Socialists, Syndicalists and Bolsheviks are weakening the stability of our Motherland. Recently they caused a panic in one of the major Russian cities as am assassin tried to kill a famous government representative. Thankfully the bomb went off too early, killing only a few people.
I want the head of the bomber on my desk!

Throughout Russian history the peasants' living conditions has always been hard, even during periods of peace and prosperity. Even the emancipation reforms of 1861, which led to the abolition of serfdom, did not improve the situation all that much. Local peasant protests against these harsh conditions, as well as landowners' illegal actions, were common.

With the situation in the countryside growing increasingly unstable the peasants became easy to influence by various agitators. One such situation has recently taken place, a charismatic activist visited a number of villages calling for open revolt against our regime. How should we react to this potential threat?
Let him agitate, we have more important business.

Agitated by various groups the impoverished peasantry has risen up. The local administration is powerless against the mob and it seems that the only way to solve the crisis is to use force. Alternatively we can always attempt to negotiate, although satisfying the peasants' demands may turn out to be quite expensive.
Send the army to eliminate the threat!
Attempt to negotiate and fulfill some demands.
column13: Попытаться провести переговоры и выполнить некотрые из их требований

column2: Even though technological advancement resulted in a slow but steady improvement of working conditions the workers remained very vulnerable to Socialist agitation. Demonstrations in cities were organised from time to time, their demands varying depending on who was pulling the strings.

Some workers in one of our cities have organised themselves and begun a strike, completely disrupting all industrial production coming from the city. They demand higher salaries and an enforcement of labour legislation preventing unfair treatment of the workforce.
Send the army to pacify them!

An attempt to negotiate with the striking workers has been made. All political forces in the country closely watch the meeting, some are hoping that the strike will become an impulse for further reforms in Russia.
column13: Была сделана попытка провести переговоры с бастующими рабочими. Все политические силы внимательно следят за забастовкой, надеясь, что она станет импульсом для дальнейших реформ в России.

column2: Reach an agreement but implement only social reforms.
column13: Прийти к соглашению, но провести только социальные реформы

column2: Reach an agreement but implement only economical reforms.
column13: Прийти к соглашению, но провести только экономические реформы

column2: The commander of a local army garrison has proposed that we use brute force in order to disperse the strikers and force them to go back to work.
column13: Командующий местного военного гарнизона предлагает использовать грубую силу для разгона бастующих и возвращения завода к работе.

column2: Why not? It's quicker than those negotiations!
column13: Почему бы и нет, это быстрее, чем переговоры

column2: No, we must not be too harsh.
The commander of a local army garrison has proposed that we use brute force in order to disperse the strikers and force them to go back to work.
column13: Командующий местного военного гарнизона предлагает использовать грубую силу для разгона бастующих и возвращения завода к работе.

column2: Why not? It's quicker than those negotiations!
column13: Почему бы и нет, это быстрее, чем переговоры

column2: No, we must not be too harsh.
The slow war of attrition between us and the strikers has been won by the government. The workers, seeing little success in their efforts, are about to call off the strike.
column13: Медленная война на истощение между нами и забастовщиками была выиграна правительством. Забастовщики, не видя особого успеха их усилий, собираются прекратить забастовку.

column2: With the crisis resolved the factories may return to their previous efficiency.
column13: С окончанием кризиса, заводы могут снова работать в полную силу.

column2: Workers organisations all over the Russia have reached an agreement and decided to call for a general strike. Even though the response to their initiative has been rather limited so far it is very possible that more and more workers will join the strike should the situation continue to deteriorate.
Workers from other factories have joined the general strike. The situation is on the brink of eruption.
column13: Рабочие с остальных наших заводов присоединились к всеобщей забастовке. Ситуация на гране взрыва.

column2: We must be prepared for the worst!
Workers from other factories have joined the general strike. The situation is on a brink of eruption.
column13: Рабочие с остальных наших заводов присоединились к всеобщей забастовке. Ситуация на гране взрыва.

column2: Workers in Tsaritsyn have organised a militia and have attacked our troops!
column13: Рабочие Царицына организовались в отряды и начали нападать на наши войска!

column2: Workers in Moscow have organised a militia and have attacked our troops!
column13: Рабочие Москвы организовались в отряды и начали нападать на наши войска!

column2: Workers in St. Petersburg have organised a militia and have attacked our troops!
column13: Рабочие Петрограда организовались в отряды и начали нападать на наши войска!

column2: An attempt to negotiate with the striking workers has been made. All political forces in the country closely watch the meeting, some are hoping that the strike will become an impulse for further reforms in Russia.
column13: Была сделана попытка провести переговоры с бастующими рабочими. Все политические силы внимательно следят за забастовкой, надеясь, что она станет импульсом для дальнейших реформ в России.

column2: Reach an agreement but implement only social reforms.
column13: Прийти к соглашению, но провести только социальные реформы

column2: With the crisis resolved the factories may return to their previous efficiency.
column13: С окончанием кризиса, заводы могут снова работать в полную силу.

column13: Местное самоуправление, земство, недавно организовало сбор средств на постройку больницы в одной из наших областей.

column2: A local self-government, Zemstvo, has recently collected funds and organised the construction of a railroad in one of our provinces.
column13: Местное самоуправление, земство, недавно организовало сбор средств на постройку железнодорожной ветки в одной из наших областей.

column2: A local self-government, Zemstvo, has recently collected funds and organised the construction of a school in one of our provinces.
column13: Местное самоуправление, земство, недавно организовало сбор средств на постройку школы в одной из наших областей.

column2: Zemstvo gather funds for the war effort
column13: Земство собирает средства на военные нужды

column2: A local self-government, Zemstvo, has recently collected funds to be donated to our military.
column13: Местное самоуправление, земство, недавно организовало сбор средств для армии.

column2: A youth organisation is happy to announce that an extraordinary number of teenagers have excelled in physical tests and were recommended to join our military.
column13: Молодежная организация рада сообщить, что многие подростки преуспели в физических испытаниях и готовы присоединиться к нашей армии.

column2: The mayor of one of our cities has proposed to organise a great patriotic ceremony to help improve morale and to commemorate our nation's heroes.
column13: Мэр одного из наших городов предложил организовать большую патриотическую церемонию, чтобы укрепить моральный дух и почтить память героев нашей страны.

column2: With the new regime established the central government has been given the means to stimulate economic growth according to our current needs.
column13: После стабилизации нового режима, правительством были выделены средства для стимулирования экономического роста в соответствии с текущими потребностями.
Сельский коллектив докладывает об излишках производства

column2: A village collective has reported that they have exceeded their projected production efficiency.
column13: Сельский коллектив сообщил, что они превысили прогнозируемую эффективность производства.

column2: A new labour collective has been formed. Socialist methods of work are being introduced as the capitalist system receives yet another blow.
column13: Был сформирован новый трудовой коллектив. Внедряются социалистические методы работы, тогда как капиталистическая система получила еще один удар.

column2: Several mines and factories have exceeded projected limits. The resource surplus is reaching our warehouses.
column13: Некоторые шахты и заводовы превысили прогнозируемую эффективность. Ресурсы в избытке на наших складах.

column2: A number of priests have voiced their disagreement with our policy of a secular and modern state. Even though this fact has little importance we must keep in mind that religion plays a huge role in common people's lives.
column13: Часть священников выразила свое недовольство нашей политикой светского и современного госудраства. Хотя этот факт и не имеет большого значения, мы должны иметь в виду, что религия играет огромную роль в жизни простых людей.

column2: Seeing increased displeasure amongst the common people the patriarch has decided to voice his concern about the increasing secularisation of our state. Even if we try to turn a deaf ear on the clergy's demands we cannot easily ignore such an influential and powerful character such as the patriarch.
Everything shall stay as it is!
Encourage a national debate on religious matters.
column13: Поощрить национальные дебаты по религиозным вопросам

column2: Seeing increased displeasure amongst the common people the patriarch has decided to voice his concern about the increasing secularisation of our state. Everything shall stay as it is!
Encourage a national debate on religious matters.
column13: Поощрить национальные дебаты по религиозным вопросам

column2: He is right, declare Orthodoxy our state religion!
column13: Он прав, объявить православие нашей государственной религией

column2: Seeing increased displeasure amongst the common people the patriarch has decided to voice his concern about the increasing secularisation of our state. He is right, declare Orthodoxy our state religion!
column13: Он прав, объявить православие нашей государственной религией

column2: Seeing increased displeasure amongst the common people the patriarch has decided to voice his concern about the increasing secularisation of our state. Even if we try to turn a deaf ear on the clergy's demands we cannot easily ignore such an influential and powerful character such as the patriarch.
Everything shall stay as it is.

Despite our secular politics there are still some religious elements within the country that wish well for its future, no matter who is in charge of the government. Yesterday a small mass was dedicated to the prosperity of our motherland.
column13: Несмотря на нашу светскую политику, есть священники, которые хотят лучшего будущего для Родины, независимо от того, кто властвует. Вчера прошла небольшая литургия, посвященная процветанию нашей Родины.

column2: A small celebration dedicated to the prosperity of our Motherland has been performed yesterday in one of our towns. Even though it was very modest in scale and attendance it attracted the conservative media's attention. Many common people consider this to be a visible sign of the Church's support for the Motherland.

A large scale celebration has taken place is our capital. Apart from thousands of common Russians, the Patriarch, members of the Romanov family and dozens of nobles, politicians and high-ranking officers have attended the mass. This is a great occasion to underline the ties between the government and the Church in these uncertain times.
A mass dedicated to our beloved ruler has been organised in the capital. The Patriarch has officially invited the tsar and members of his family to take part in the ceremony.
column13: Литургия, посвященная нашему любимому правителю, прошла в столице. Патриарх официально пригласил царя и членов его семьи, для принятия участия в церемонии.

column2: It seems that the liberal elements of our government consider it rather unwise to maintain such strong bonds between the Church and the state. During a small demonstration in the capital they have demanded more religious pluralism and secularisation of the government.
Encourage a national debate on religious matters.
column13: Поощрить национальные дебаты по религиозным вопросам

column2: It seems that the liberal elements of our society consider it rather unwise to maintain such strong bonds between the Church and the state. During a small demonstration in the capital they have demanded more religious pluralism and secularisation of the government.
Encourage a national debate on religious matters.
column13: Поощрить национальные дебаты по религиозным вопросам

column2: This event is designed to keep the selected HoS in place, despite political changes.
column13: Это событие призвано сохранить выбранного главу государства на месте, несмотря на политические изменения.

column2: The President of Russian Republic, Alexander Kerensky has been assassinated ! While president Kerensky was being slowly driven in a car through the streets Petrograd, an unknown gunman stepped from street and shot the president and his chauffeur with a Mauser C96 semiautomatic pistol. Despite immediate aid Kerensky died in the car, slumped backwards in the seat, with his eyes open.
The Aftermath of Assassination of Kerensky

The assassination of our long term president, Alexander Kerensky, has thrown the country into chaos. With the president gone the governing coalition of Kadets and Right Social Revolutionaries has collapsed and four forces look ready to seize control of the broken nation.
The Left SR-Mensheviks secure a majority in the Duma.
column13: Левые эсеры и меньшевики получают большинство в Думе

column2: Marshall Denikin declares martial law and dissolves the Duma.
column13: Маршал Деникин объявляет военное положение и распускает Думу

column2: Wrangel's officers seize the apparatus of state!
The Aristocrats in the Senate elect Grand Duke Dmitri as the new President.
column13: Сенат избирает в качестве нового президента великого князя Дмитрия Павловича

column2: The Prime Minister Addresses the Duma
The Duma ensures Russian freedom and Russian greatness!

A few days after seizing power, Marshal Denikin went forward to address the troubled Russian people. A man of humble origins, Denikin is perceived as a patriot with pragmatic, but Republican convictions. In his widely publicized speech, the marshal declared his intention to maintain order and stability in Russia by any means necessary - even if it means compromising with the more extreme rightist groups.
The Peasant Marshal shall bring order to holy Russia!

The remnants of Russia's nobility emerged from the turmoil of the civil war with much of their wealth intact. Still controlling large portions of the economy, the aristocrats dominated the Senate, the theoretically powerless Upper House. They have now taken advantage of the body's nominal authority to name the President and have selected Grand Duke Dmitri Pavlovich Romanov for the position. It is unclear who is the true instigator.
The reactionary landowners, led by Vladimir Purishkevich.
The Kadets and liberals of Pavel Milyukov.
Felix Yusupov, the childhood friend of the Grand Duke!

The SR-Menshevik coalition out-maneuvered all of its rivals in the January crisis and have gained an unshakeable Duma majority following the submission of the Kadets. Chernov, chief ideologue of the SRs, has been successful in pulling the strings but it is now the time to appoint a Prime Minister.
Stay with the Mensheviks, Iraklij Tsereteliy.
These are extreme times and we need a shot of Bolshevism, Nikolai Bukharin!
column13: В эти тяжелые времени мы должны избрать большевиков - Николай Бухарин

column2: The Duma has been dissolved and martial law declared. Marshal Anton Denikin is now nominally of control of the country. A Prime Minister should be appointed for the new regime to broaden its basis of support.
column13: Дума была распущена и введено военное положение. Номинально сейчас управляет страной маршал Антон Деникин. Однако, необходимо назначить премьер-министра, чтобы новый режим получил поддержку.

column2: Keep Kerensky's Prime Minister, Pavel Milyukov.
The leader of the Conservatives, Patriarch Kiril.
The chief of the reactionary landowners, Vladimir Purishkevich.

Wrangel's secret cabals of extremist officers control the streets, all senior Duma deputies are under arrest awaiting liquidation and communication lines are closely monitored. Baron Wrangel is in control and poised to build a new state but he needs a right hand man to carry out his ambitions.
The most promising of my lackeys, General Pavel Shatilov.
The leader of the Conservatives, Patriarch Kiril.
The flamboyant aristocrat, Felix Yusupov, will bring glamour to the Dictatorship!
column13: Напыщенный аристократ, Феликс Юсупов, придаст обаяние диктатуре!

column2: Pfah! I am the new Autocrat!
Officially recognise the Soviets and village Communes.
column13: Официально признать советы и сельские коммуны

column2: Re-institute the Zemstva and work through local elites.
column13: Возродить институт земств и работать через местную элиту

column2: Create a new bureaucracy and govern from the centre.
Officially recognise the Soviets and village Communes.
column13: Официально признать советы и сельские коммуны

column2: Re-institute Zemstva and work through local elites.
Create a new bureaucracy and govern from the centre.
Re-institute Zemstva and work through local elites.
Create a new bureaucracy and govern from the centre.
All peasants should stay in their own territorial communes!
Create a new bureaucracy and govern from the centre.
Weld all sections of society into one corporate state!

Prime Minister-Patriarch Kiril provoked a major crisis and has threatened to resign his position unless the Synod of the Russian Church be allowed to exercise veto power on all new legislation. He has also demanded that the monasteries should benefit from public taxation and that priests should be granted a high salary, paid for by the state. There are even rumours about his support for a restoration of Tsarism, a move that our people are still not ready for!
We are a modern state, get rid of the priest!
column13: Мы современное государство! Избавиться от патриарха!

column2: Install the legitimate autocrat for Holy Mother Russia!

The Orthodox Church, under the leadership of the vocal Patriarch Kiril, is demanding a clarification of its legal status in the Russian Republic. He wants a constitutional amendment passed on the issue of our national religion.
The Orthodox Church must have a role in government!
column13: Православная церковь должна играть большую роль в правительстве!

column2: The Orthodox Church, under the leadership of the vocal Patriarch Kiril, is demanding a clarification of its legal status in the Russian Republic. He wants a constitutional amendment passed on the issue of our national religion.
The Orthodox Church must have a role in government!
column13: Православная церковь должна играть большую роль в правительстве!

column2: The Orthodox Church, under the leadership of the vocal Patriarch Kiril, is demanding a clarification of its legal status in the Russian Republic. He wants a constitutional amendment passed on the issue of our national religion.
The Orthodox Church must have a role in government!
column13: Православная церковь должна играть большую роль в правительстве!

column2: Prime Minister-Patriarch Kiril has provoked a major crisis by demanding that the Synod of the Russian Church be allowed to exercise veto power on all new legislation. There are even rumours about his support for a restoration of Tsarism, a move that our people are still not ready for! He is too popular to dismiss and he will not give up his new power. How should we react?

column13: Мы не можем согласиться с этим

column2: Install the legitimate autocrat for Holy Mother Russia!

Our government has been in power for almost a year now and we have enacted many important reforms. However, we must firmly set out our policy on how we want our country to develop so that we may truly become a global power once more.
column13: Наше правительство находится у власти почти год. В течение этого времени было принято много важных реформ, однако, мы должны проводить твердую политику в отношении развития нашей страны, если мы снова хотим стать мировой державой.

column2: A modern state needs a good industrial base!
column13: Современное государство нуждается в хорошей производственной базе

column2: We are a nation of peasants, to the fields!

Our government has been in power for almost a year now and we have enacted many important reforms. However, we must firmly set out our policy on how we want our country to develop so that we may truly become a global power once more.

column2: A modern state needs a good industrial base!
column13: Современное государство нуждается в хорошей производственной базе

column2: We are a nation of peasants, to the fields!

Recent military exercises have led to one irrefutable conclusion, the Russian army is a mess! Sweeping reforms are needed if we are to be taken seriously by our neighbours. Each of our top commanders has come up with a plan. Their proposals await your consultation.
Denikin: set up a mass conscript army to overwhelm the enemy.
column13: Деникин: создадим большую армию из призывников

column2: Wrangel: a modern military under a centralised high-command.
Shatilov: promote officers' own initiative at the front.
Markov: a new doctrine of speed and armoured vehicles.
Sergei Markov and His Armoured Doctrine
Invest in the construction of armoured formations!
We cannot afford such an investment.

More than a year have passed since our assumption of power and our regime looks as if it is here to stay. However, many voices are being raised on the issue of constitutional reform. Perhaps the Republic no longer serves our purposes?
column13: Более года прошло с момента нашего прихода к власти, и наш режим стал достаточно стабилен. Тем не менее многие ставят вопрос о конституционной реформе. Возможно, республика больше нам не нужна?

column2: We must maintain our progressive republic!
column13: Мы должны сохранить нашу прогрессивную республику!

column2: We should be a liberal constitutional monarchy.
column13: Мы должны стать либеральной конституционной монархией

column2: It is time to restore the proletarian dictatorship!
column13: Пришло время для восстановления диктатуры пролетариата!

column2: More than a year have passed since our assumption of power and we have bought some measure of stability to the country. Many believe that we need to take greater measures to promote the cause of order.
column13: Более года прошло с момента нашего прихода к власти, и положение в стране в какой-то мере стабилизировалось. Но многие полагают, мы должны принять более серьезные меры для поддержания стабильности.

column2: Maintain the present order of things.
Long live the Republic! Enforce and enhance civil liberties!
We need a liberal constitutional monarchy.

More than a year have passed since our assumption of power and our regime looks as if it is here to stay. However, many voices are being raised on the issue of constitutional reform. Perhaps the republic no longer serves our purposes?
column13: Более года прошло с момента нашего прихода к власти, и наш режим стал достаточно стабилен. Тем не менее многие ставят вопрос о конституционной реформе. Возможно, республика больше нам не нужна?

column2: More than a year have passed since our assumption of power and we have bought some measure of stability to the country. However, many believe we need to take greater measures to promote the cause of order. Some are even arguing that we bring the political system back to the certainties of the Tsarist era.

Our regime is now established throughout the country and a new order is coming into being. However, many are wondering just how grand Wrangel's ambitions are and they are comparing his power to the Tsars of the old Russian Empire. A clarification of his status is needed.
I am the Vozhd, the modern autocrat!
Invite the legitimate Tsar to be the national figurehead.
column13: Пригласить законного царя в качестве номинального правителя

column2: An Emperor like Grand Duke Dmitri Pavlovich could be easier to control.
column13: Дмитрия Павловича в качестве императора будет легко контролировать

column2: Peter is a fine name for a Tsar, it is time to organise a coronation!

Grand Duke Dmitri has been president for more than a year now and his time in office has been a great success. The people are once again becoming accustomed to the rule by their social betters and now could be perfect time to restore the Tsarist system. But who should be Tsar?
Invite the legitimate Tsar to restore the autocracy.
column13: Пригласить законного царя и восстановить самодержавие

column2: Invite the legitimate Tsar to head a Constitutional Monarchy.
column13: Пригласить законного царя возглавить конституционную монархию

column2: Dmitri Pavlovich is the legitimate Tsar and autocrat after all!
column13: Дмитрий Павлович законный царь и самодержец!

column2: His Royal Highness, Kyril Romanov, Tsar and Autocrat of All the Russias, has died less than two years after the Restoration! Thankfully, the line of succession is now clear, his young son Vladimir shall be crowned as the new Tsar.
Long live the Tsar, ordained by the Wisdom of God!
column13: Да здравствует царь, посвященный мудростью божьей!

column2: His Royal Highness, Kyril Romanov, Tsar of All the Russias, has died less than two years after the Restoration! Thankfully, the line of succession is clear, his young son Vladimir shall be crowned as the new Tsar.
Long live the Tsar, raised high by the Will of the People!
column13: Да здравствует царь возвышенный волей народа!

column2: The recoginzed legitamate candidate to the Russian throne, Kyril Romanov, has died today. His son Vladimir is now the main Romanov pretender to the throne.
The Romanov pretender, Kyril Romanov, has died. His son Vladimir is in his early twenties and may make an excellent and pliable figurehead as Tsar. Perhaps now it is time to restore the Monarchy?
column13: Претендент Романовых, Кирилл, скончался сегодня. Его сыну Владимиру уже двадцать лет, и он может стать номинальным царем. Возможно пришло время для восстановления монархии?

column2: Yes, a new Tsar shall promote order and stability!
column13: Да, новый царь содействует порядку и стабильности

column2: No. The Tsarist system shall never rise again.
The Romanov pretender, Kyril Romanov, has died. His son Vladimir is in his early twenties and may make an excellent and pliable figurehead as Tsar. Perhaps now it is time to restore the Monarchy?
column13: Претендент Романовых, Кирилл, скончался сегодня. Его сыну Владимиру уже двадцать лет, и он может стать номинальным царем. Возможно пришло время для восстановления монархии?

column2: Yes, our people will enjoy a spectacular coronation!
No, the time of the Tsars is over.
Either of Russia's historic capitals could become the home of our government. Where should we go?
column13: Наше правительство может разместится в любой из исторических столиц. Какой город мы выберем?

column2: Following the Bolsheviks' demise, the rightful government finally returns to Petrograd.
column13: После поражения большевиков, законное правительство России возвращается в Петроград.

column2: Long live Russia, One and Indivisible!
Following the Bolsheviks' demise, the rightful government finally returns to Moscow.
column13: После поражения большевиков, законное правительство России возвращается в Москву.

column2: Long live Russia, One and Indivisible!

According to the Constitution elections are to be held every five years. Although Kerensky's assassination caused major turmoil in Russia, the VIII Duma has managed to wait out the storm and elections should proceed without interruption. But who will triumph?
The Tsar shall put an end to this chaotic democracy!
column13: Царь должен положить конец хаосу демократии!

According to the Constitution elections are to be held every five years. Although Kerensky's assassination caused major turmoil in Russia, the VIII Duma has managed to wait out the storm and elections should proceed without interruption. But who will triumph?

According to our constitution a new president should be elected after Kerensky's assasination. However, political turmoil has caused a delay in the procedure and elections could proceed only after the IX Duma was chosen. Now the time has come to settle the one final dispute in our government. Who should the Senate choose to lead the country?
Viktor Chernov, leader of the SR Party.

column13: Василий Маклаков, представитель кадетов и либералов

column2: Dmitri Pavlovich Romanov, an aristocratic candidate.
column13: Дмитрий Павлович Романов, кандидат от аристократов

column2: Solomon Lozovsky, the People's Tribune of our times!

With Kerensky's assasination and the dissolution of the SR-Kadet coalition a great reshuffling of the Russian political scene has taken place. The most visible result of the process was the creation of the so-called New Bolshevik bloc, a conglomerate of the Civil War survivors, radical former Mensheviks and SR members as well as fresh Syndicalist blood. It is very possible that this bloc will take part in the nearest Duma elections, should the situation finally stabilise.
We should keep a close eye on them!
column13: Мы должны внимательно следить за ними

column2: Kerensky's death meant that the fragile SR-Kadet coalition was no more. An attempt to flirt with the less radical faction of the communists, the Mensheviks, failed to bring the SR back into power. As a result the Menshevik leaders, with their leader Irakli Tsereteli, have declared the coalition as invalid. Even though this has little effect on the government the potential consequences may be great, with even a Menshevik-Bolshevik coalition possible.

Kerensky's death meant that the fragile SR-Kadet coalition was no more. Even though the SR-Menshevik coalition has resulted in the two parties gaining considerable influence on the government ideological differences between the two parties were too great to maintain a coherent coalition, resulting in the Mensheviks leaving the government. This gives way to great possibilities, including a Menshevik-Bolshevik coalition in the near future.

Dmitri Romanov's authority and charisma was one of the few things that kept the Russian conservatives strong and vibrant. With his death the movement quickly split into two branches, the so-called Siloviki, organised around marshal Denikin and consisting mostly of White military officers, and the conservative civilians, gathered around professor Nikolai Trubetskoy.

Dmitri Romanov's authority and charisma was one of the few things that kept the Russian conservatives strong and vibrant. With his death the movement quickly split into two branches, the so-called Siloviki, organised around marshal Denikin and consisting mostly of White military officers, and the conservative civilians, gathered around professor Nikolai Trubetskoy. Without his protector Yusupov was quickly replaced by Trubetskoy.

According to the Constitution elections are to be held every five years. The IX Duma's term has expired and the time has come to elect a new parliament. With the conservatives and left-wing forces in disarray these elections may lead to surprising results.
The Tsar shall put an end to this chaotic democracy!
column13: Царь должен положить конец хаосу демократии!

column2: The conservatives have secured a majority in the Duma. The question is which faction?
column13: Консерваторы набрали большинство в Думе. Вопрос в том чья фракция?

column2: According to the Constitution elections are to be held every five years. The IX Duma's term has expired and the time has come to elect a new parliament. Dissolve the Duma and place loyal officers in the Army!
column13: Распустите Думу и назначьте лояльных офицеров в армию!

The Kadets, liberals, and royalists overthrow the Bolsheviks!

column13: Распустите Думу и назначьте лояльных офицеров в армию!

column13: Удивительно, но правые партии победили на выборах. Но которая из них?

column2: One of the most experienced politicians in Russia, Boris Sturmer, has passed away due to a heart attack upon hearing the news of Kerensky's assasination. Born in 1848, Sturmer was one of the few people in Russia to remember the Crimean War. He was a symbol of Russia's tradition and continuity.

A hero of the Civil War and the leader of the militarist political faction has passed away peacefully in his manor near Tsaritsyn. A week of national mourning was declared as the people bade farewell to the so-called Black Baron.
column13: Герой гражданской войны и лидер милитаристской политической фракции вчера мирно скончался в своем поместье около Царицына. Была объявлена неделя национального траура для прощания народа с Черным бароном.

column2: A leader of the White Movement of the Civil War, Pyotr Wrangel, has passed away in his apartment in Tsaritsyn. Despite being an active opponent of the progressive movements within Russia Wrangel enjoyed quite a lot of popular support. His death is nevertheless seen as a step towards stability and progress in Russia.

Pyotr Wrangel has passed peacefully while visiting his summer residence. He had not named a successor and it is uncertain what Russia's future will be. The legal pretender, Vladimir Romanov, waits for a chance to assume power and restore the legitimate dynasty while liberal movements argue for a restoration of the republic. Nevertheless, before a decision is made a month of mourning and funeral celebrations have been announced.
Invite Vladimir and restore the Romanovs as autocrats!
column13: Пригласить Владимира и восстановить Романовых на престоле

column2: Invite Vladimir and restore the Romanovs as constitutional monarchs.
column13: Пригласить Владимира в качестве конституционного монарха

column2: Pavel Shatilov takes control of Russia!

An honourable Socialist activist and a member of the SR party, Victor Chernov, has passed away. The former chairman of the Russian Constituent Assembly and the leader of the anti-Bolshevik Socialist party of the Civil War, Chernov has also greatly contributed to the political development of post-war Russia.

An honourable socialist activist and a member of the SR party, Victor Chernov, has passed away. The former chairman of the Russian Constituent Assembly and the leader of the anti-Bolshevik Socialist party of the Civil War, Chernov has also greatly contributed to the political development of post-war Russia. The Senate will retain his powers until the next election.

A hero of the Civil War and the informal leader of Russian conservatives, Anton Ivanovich Denikin, died yesterday in his manor. Although never as radical as his counterpart, Baron Wrangel, Denikin's influence throughout Russia was hard to overestimate. A week of national mourning has been declared as the people bade farewell to one of the few true heroes of Russia.
Even the strongest die one day!

A hero of the Civil War and the informal leader of Russian conservatives, Anton Ivanovich Denikin, died yesterday in his manor. Although never as radical as his counterpart, Baron Wrangel, Denikin's influence throughout Russia was hard to overestimate. A week of national mourning has been declared as the people bade farewell to one of the few true heroes of Russia. Grand Admiral Vasily Kanin has been selected to replace him.
Even the strongest die one day!
Invite Vladimir and restore the Romanovs as autocrats.
column13: Пригласить Владимира и восстановить Романовых на престоле

column2: Invite Vladimir and restore the Romanovs as constitutional monarchs.
column13: Пригласить Владимира в качестве конституционного монарха

column2: The Military will continue its rule over Russia!

A great liberal and a proponent of the democratic system in Russia, Pyotr B. Struve, has passed away. A member of the Kadet Party and a skilled politician before, during and after the Civil War, Struve shall be remembered as one of the greatest patriots in our history.
One of the most prominent reactionary politicians and a staunch supporter of Baron Wrangel, Viktor L. Pokrovsky, has passed away yesterday.
A theoretician of Russian liberalism, prime minister of several governments and the former right hand of late president Kerensky has passed away in his manor near Nizhny Novgorod.
column13: Теоретик русского либерализма, премьер-министр нескольких правительств и правая рука бывшего президента Керенского скончался в своем поместье около Нижнего Новгорода.

column2: A theoretician of Russian liberalism, prime minister of several governments and the former right hand of late president Kerensky has passed away in his manor near Nizhny Novgorod. The liberal general Vasily G. Boldyrev will take his place as prime minister of Russia.

A notable figure of the conservative movement and perhaps the last true landowner in Russia has died yesterday in his rural estate. It is feared that his death may cause a great reshuffling on the right side of the political scene.
column13: Известная фигура консервативного движения и возможно последний истинный помещик России умер вчера в своем загородном поместье. Его смерть может вызвать большую перестановку на правой стороне политической сцены.

column2: A renowned officer died yesterday in his apartament in St. Petersburg.
column13: Известный чиновник вчера умер в своей квартире в Петрограде.

column2: Our beloved tsar has died yesterday due to tuberculosis. In his last will and testament Dmitri II expressed a desire for his son, Pavel, to inherit the crown. However, the young tsarevich is only 12 so the prime minister would have to act as regent until Pavel II comes of age. This means that anti-monarchic elements in the government are likely to make an attempt to overthrow the monarchy and reestablish a republic. Besides, there is the legitimite pretender Vladimir waiting for his chance.
Crown Pavel II with the Prime Minister as regent.
column13: Коронавать Павла II и назначить премьер-министра регентом

column2: The Kadets and liberals force the restoration of the republic!
Compromise, invite Vladimir Romanov as constitutional monarch.
Vladimir Romanov takes the throne by force!

President Dmitri Pavlovich, who has proven his talents during the turbulent period after Kerensky's assasination, has died yesterday due to tuberculosis. According to the constitution his duties should be taken over by the Senate until the time for elections comes next year.

Dmitri Pavlovich Romanov has died yesterday due to tuberculosis. A notorious participant of St. Petersburg's various infamous parties, Dmitri Romanov has nevertheless proven himself to be quite a capable member of the Senate, especially in the days following the assassination of president Kerensky.

Ivan Petrovich Pavlov, the widely known Russian physiologist, died today at 86 in Saint-Petersburg. He recieved the Nobel Prize in Medicine in 1904 for his research on the digestive system but he is mostly known for his works on classical conditioning. The Russian president expressed his sadness and announced that his laboratory would soon become a museum.
Let's hope that classical conditioning works on humans.

Russian writer Alexei Maximovich Peshkov, better known under his pen name Maxim Gorky, died today in Moscow at 68. A fellow traveler of the Bolsheviks, he experienced oppression under the Czarist regime but was quite doubtful during the October Revolution, thus avoiding reprisals after the Civil War. A rabid opponent of Kerensky, he publicly supported Bukharin. As he narrowly followed his son in death many think that his sudden death could be due to the changing political atmosphere in Russia.
I assure you, 68 is old age!

A pre-revolutionary prime minister and perhaps the oldest politician still in active service has passed away. The people mass in Petersburg to participate in his funeral. A conservative newspaper even stated that 'his and Sturmer's deaths mark the end of a glorious era of Russian history'.
A noted architect, known for designing the current outlook of the Yalta resort, has passed away. The government plans to erect a monument for him in the city should an opportunity arise.
column13: Скончался известный архитектор, известный проектом Ялтинского курорта. Было предложено установить ему памятник.

column2: Marshal Kornilov, one of the four officers that led the White Movement against the Bolsheviks during the civil war, has passed away. Serving as a link between the moderate Denikin and the more reactionary Baron Wrangel, Kornilov has greatly contributed to post-revolutionary Russia's politics. Two weeks of national mourning have been declared as the people prepare for the funeral ceremony.

A notable Menshevik politician and 'the most Russian of all Georgians', Irakli Tsereteli, has passed away. Forced to flee Georgia due to a power struggle with Beria, Tsereteli devoted himself to the prosperity of his new home, Russia.
column13: Известный меньшевик и 'самый русский из всех грузин' скончался. Вынужденный бежать в Россию из-за борьбы за власть с Берией, Церетели посвятил себя процветанию его нового дома - России.

column2: A notable Menshevik politician and 'the most Russian of all Georgians', Irakli Tsereteli, has passed away. Forced to flee Georgia due to a power struggle with Beria, Tsereteli devoted himself to the prosperity of his new home, Russia. Lazer Kaganovich will succeed him as the leader of the Menshevik party.
One of the few Bolsheviks to survive the Revolution and the leader of the International wing of the party has passed away in his sleep.
column13: Один из немногих выживших после революции большевиков, лидер интернационального крыла партии, скончался во сне.

column2: Bishop Sergius has passed away in his sleep.
Alexei Rykov, the leader of the Menshevik party, has passed away. Even though he opposed Lenin during the Revolution he was later known for supporting his successors, Kirov and Bukharin.

column2: Alexei Rykov, the leader of the Menshevik party, has passed away. Even though he opposed Lenin during the Revolution he was later known for supporting his successors, Kirov and Bukharin. Irakli Tsereteli will succeed him as the party's leader.

column2: The successor to Denikin and a renowned military commander of the Civil War has passed away. His adjutant, Sergey Markov, will take his place.

column2: Our chief of the navy has died today in his manor near Petrograd. Grand Admiral Kanin will replace him as the next chief of the navy.

Nadezhda Krupskaya has passed away. Being Lenin's widow, she became the symbol for all remaining Bolsheviks after the disaster of the Civil War. In 1922 she was elected in the VI Duma and started a campaign against illiteracy which had been supported by the President and launched in 1924. She decided not to participate in the VIII Duma elections. Her last official appearance was on the first Council of the Novye Bolsheviki bloc, there she blessed Bukharin and said 'Lenin has died, but his cause lives!'
A renowned liberal economist has passed away yesterday.
A renowned Kadet economist has passed away yesterday.
column13: Вчера скончался известный кадет и экономист.

column2: A renowned SR politician has passed away yesterday.

column13: Герой Гражданской войны умер вчера на своей даче около Иркутска.

column2: One of the most promonent military figures in the Army has passed away today.

column13: Герой Гражданской войны мирно скончался на своей даче возле Смоленска.

column2: Almost three weeks ago the Berlin Stock Exchange plunged into a bottomless depth, throwing Germany's economy into an unprecedented crisis. Now the crash's shockwaves have reached Russia. German and Bohemian-owned companies have closed down or laid off their workers, the Russian ruble is losing value, and resource exports are shrinking.
Let's hope the goverment will save us from the worst!
With the first wave of the crisis slowly passing by some less affected branches of the economy have bounced off the bottom. Still, the overall state of our economy does not look optimistic.
column13: С окончанием первой волны кризиса, некоторые из наименее пострадавших отраслей экономики начали оживать. Тем не менее, общее состояние нашей экономики не выглядит оптимистично...

column2: Letґs hope stabilisation will come soon!
With political stabilisation finally in place, we are prepared to enact a series of intensive reforms, aimed at restoring pre-crisis industrial power.

column2: The economy continues to regain pre-crisis efficiency.

Siberia is once again a stable Russian province, mostly due to the defeat of the Mongols and Transamur. Now we can enact economic policies to develop Siberia and efficiently use its resources without the threat of the Japanese or the Central Asian tribes. Thanks to our pro-capitalist orientiation many Russian companies have begun to invest in light and heavy industry in South Siberia and the Urals.

Siberia is once again a stable Russian province, mostly due to the defeat of the Mongols and Transamur. Now we can enact economic policies to develop Siberia and efficiently use its resources without the threat of the Japanese or the Central Asian tribes. Thanks to our pro-centralised orientiation our government is able to invest in light and heavy industry in South Siberia and the Urals.

After securing a majority in the Duma the Kadet-Liberal coalition has proposed an extensive economic reform project to introduce free market policies in Russia. However, their proposal is opposed not only by the opposition but by the considerable Kadet part of the coalition as well. The present system satisfies the Constitutional Democrats quite well.
The current system suits us fine.

After securing a majority in the Duma the Kadet-Liberal coalition has proposed an extensive economic reform project to introduce free market policies in Russia. It is very likely that the proposition will pass but it may cause very violent reactions from the Socialists and conservatives. To prevent such a situation the Kadets have proposed a moderate variant of the project.

After securing a majority in the Duma the socialists have proposed an extensive reform project to reform the state economy along Socialist lines. However, such a rapid change may lead to great opposition from the liberals, industrial entrepreneurs, and conservatives. The less radical members of the SR party have therefore made up several less radical variants of the project.
Nationalise the industrial sector and begin building a social system!
column13: Национализировать промышленность и начать строительство социалистической системы

The less radical members of the SR party have therefore made up several less radical variants of the project.
Nationalise the industrial sector and begin building a social system!

We have retaken the Mongolian part of our Transiberian railroad and found some industries, constructed during Ungern's rule. Unfortunately part of industrial equipment and a few factories were destroyed by hard-line nationalists, as a last desperate act of defiance against Russia.

Astrakhan and the surrounding areas are under our total control. Unfortunately part of the industrial equipment and a few factories were destroyed by hard-line nationalists, as a last desperate act of defiance against Russia.

We have reclaimed the Kazakh territory around the Aral sea. Unfortunately part of the industrial equipment and a few factories were destroyed by hard-line nationalists, as a last desperate act of defiance against Russia.

We have retaken the eastern part of Kazakhstan, north of lake Balkhash. Unfortunately part of the industrial equipment and a few factories were destroyed by hard-line nationalists, as a last desperate act of defiance against Russia.

Alma-Ata or Verny as it has been known before the Civil War is the biggest city of Kazakhstan and biggest industrial centre. Unfortunately part of the industrial equipment and a few factories were destroyed by hard-line nationalists, as a last desperate act of defiance against Russia.

We finally have reclaimed the Kuban region and once more got access to the Black Sea as well as the industrial potential of this territory. Unfortunately part of the industrial equipment and a few factories were destroyed by hard-line nationalists, as a last desperate act of defiance against Russia.

Transamur is no more. People are celebrating this glorious event. The problem is those damn Japanese capitalists, they have done everything to prevent us from taking their factories. During the last few days they evacuated or destroyed a lot of equipment, and we could do nothing against them.
Our citizens are fleeing the now Russian-controlled Primorsk. Among them are many capitalists, who managed to evacuate their assets and are ready to restart their operations in Japan.
column13: Наши граждане бегут из Заамурья, которое теперь принадлежит России. Среди них много капиталистов, которые сумели эвакуировать их активы и готовы начать операции в Японии.

column2: The capital of Azerbaijan has been taken by our forces, it was a heavy, although brief fight. During the battle some factories of the city were destroyed, and may never be reconstructed.
column13: Столица Азербайджана была захвачена нашими войсками, в тяжелом, хотя и коротком бою. Во время сражения некоторые фабрики города были разрушены, и не подлежат восстановлению.

column2: The capital of Georgia have been taken by our forces, it was a heavy, although brief fight. During the battle some factories of the city were destroyed, and may never be reconstructed
column13: Столица Грузии была захвачена нашими войсками, в тяжелом, хотя и коротком бою. Во время сражения некоторые фабрики города были разрушены, и не подлежат восстановлению.

column2: The war in Central Asia is over. Our fight against Turkestan was hard, but it was just. The sins they committed against humanity were grave. And we had our revenge. During the plundering some industries were unfortunately robbed and destroyed.
Our intensive industrialisation programme has produced first results.
column13: Правительственная помощь и протецкионистская политика принесли результаты

column2: With new agricultural technology being imported from abroad, as well as developed within Russia, our production is slowly, yet steadily rising. This in turn results in redistribution of employees from agriculture to more modern branches of the economy.
column13: Новые сельскохозяйственные технологии, полученные из-за границы, а так же разработанные в России, медленно, но все же устойчиво повышают наше производство. Это в свою очередь привело к перераспределению служащих из сельского хозяйства в более современные отрасли экономики.

column2: With new agricultural technology being imported from abroad, as well as developed within Russia, our production is slowly, yet steadily rising. This in turn results in redistribution of employees from agriculture to more modern branches of the economy.
